sourceString: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020
targetString: ካብ ጃኑዋሪ 1 እስካብ ማርች 15 2020 ኣብዘሎ፡ ኣብ ኣውሮፓ ሕብረትን/ናይ ኣውሮፓ ቁጠባዊ ቦታትን ኣብ እንግሊዝን ናይ ኮሮና ቫይረስ ሕማም(COVID-19) ውህሉል ኣጋጣሚታት ብ ቕልጡፍ እናዓበየ እዩ።
en-mt: From 1 January to 15 March 2020, the cumulative incidence of the coronavirus (COVID-19) in the European Union and/or European Economic Areas and the UK is growing rapidly.

sourceString: The cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, while at a different stage depending on the country, the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in all countries.
targetString: እቲ ዝዋህለለ ናይ ሕማም ኮረና ቫይረስ (COVID-19) ዘጋጠሙ ጉዳያት ኣብ ኣውሮፓ ሕብረት/ኣውሮፓ ቁጠባዊ ዓውዲ ዘለዋ ሃገራት ን ኣብ እንግሊዝን ተመሳሳሊ ዝኾነ ምዕባለ እናርኣየ ይርከብ፡ ኣብ ዝተፈላለዩ ደረጃታት ድማ፡ ከከም ሃገራቱ ናይ COVID-19 ለበዳ ኣዝዩ ቅልጡፍ ብዝኾነ መልክዑ ኣብ ኩለን ሃገራት እናወሰኸ ይርከብ።
en-mt: The cumulative cases of the coronavirus (COVID-19) are showing similar developments in the EU/European Economic Area and in the UK, and at various levels, depending on the country the COVID-19 epidemic is very rapid in all countries It is increasing.

sourceString: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for a surge of patients with COVID-19 who will require healthcare, and in particular intensive care.
targetString: ብመሰረት ካብ ጣልያን ዝተወሰደ ተመኩሮ፡ ሃገራት፡ ሆስፒታላትን ናይ ጽኑዕ ክንክን ክፍሊታትን ነቶም ክመጹ ዝኽእሉ ናይ ጥዕና ክንክን ዝደልዩ ብፍላይ ድማ ጽኑዕ ክንክን ዝጠልቡ ን ናይ COVID-19 ሕሙማት ዋሕዚ ድልውነቶም ክውሰኹ ይግባእ።
en-mt: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care payments should increase their readiness for the flow of COVID-19 patients to those who may need health care, especially those requiring intensive care.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown aetiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: ኣብ ዲሰምበር 31 2019 ፡ መምጽኢኦም ዘይፍለጡ ናይ ኒሞንያ ጉዳያት ጉጅለ ካብ ዉሃን ፡ ሁበይ ግዝኣት ፡ ቻይና ተጸብጺቡ።
en-mt: On December 31, 2019, a group of pneumonia cases of unknown origin were reported from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the causative agent as being a novel coronavirus now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: ኣብ ጃኑዋሪ 9 2020፡ ናይ China Center for Disease Control and Prevention (ቻይና ማእኸል ምቁጽጻር ን ምክልኻልን ሕማም) እቲ ናይ ሕማም መልዓሊ ኖቨል ኮረና ቫይረስ 2 ኮይኑ ሐዚ ድማ SARS-CoV-2 ተባሂሉ ከምዝጽዋዕ ጸብጺቡ።
en-mt: On January 9 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported that the cause of the disease was the novel coronavirus 2, now called SARS-CoV-2

sourceString: Since, the illness resulting from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: በዚ ድማ፣ ብSARS-CoV-2 ዝመፅእ ኢንፌክሽን ሕማም ኮሮና ቫይረስ (COVID-19) ተባሂሉ ተሰይሙ።
en-mt: Thus, the infection caused by SARS-CoV-2 was named the coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

sourceString: Evidence to date is that ca 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have a mild disease, i.e. a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these recover.
targetString: ክሳብ ሐዚ ብዘሎ መረዳእታታት 80% COVID-19 ዘለዎም ውልቀሰባት ከም ናይ መተንፈሲ ቱቦ ረኸሲ ዝበሉ ናይ ሳንቡእ ወቕዒ ዘለዎምን ዘይብሎምን ፈኲስ ሕማም ዝነበሮም እዮም።
en-mt: According to the data available to date, 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have had a mild illness with or without a pulmonary stroke such as a respiratory tract infection.

sourceString: In ca 14% cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalisation while the remaining 6% cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.
targetString: ናይ COVID-19 14% ጉዳያት ለበዳ ሓደገኛ ዝኾነ ናብ ሕክምና ምኽያድ ዘየድልዮ ሕማም እንትኾኑ እቶም ዝተረፉ 6% ጉዳያት ለበዳ ድማ ላዕለዋይ ሓገዝ ዘድልዮም ፅኑዕ ሕሙማት እዮም።
en-mt: 14% of COVID-19 outbreak cases are serious non-admission cases, while the remaining 6% are critical patients in need of intensive care.

sourceString: The mortality of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is ca 4%.
targetString: ብ CoVID-19 ሕክምና ካብ ዝኣተዉ ሕሙማት 4% ናይ ሞት መጠን ተመዝጊቡ ኣሎ።
en-mt: There is a 4% mortality rate among patients admitted to treatment for CoVID-1

sourceString: In this study, we assess the trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to that of Hubei Province, China.
targetString: ኣብ እዚ መፅናዕቲ ኣብ ሕድሕድ ናይ ኣዉሮፓ ሕብረት/ኣዉሮፓ ቁጠባዊ ቦታ(EU/EEA) ዘለዋ ሃገራትን ዩናይትድ ኪንግደምን (UK) ዝርከቡ ድምር COVID-19 ጉዳያት ለበዳ ምስ ሁቤይ ናይ ቻይና ክፋል ሃገር ዘሎ ምዕባለታት ዳህሲስና ኣለና።
en-mt: In this study, we have examined the trends in the total COVID-19 epidemic cases in each EU/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) with Hubei, part of China.

sourceString: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.
targetString: ካብ ጃኑዋሪ 31- ማርች 15 2020 ኣብዘሎ ጊዜ ኣብ EU/EEA ሃገራትን ኣብ እንግሊዝ ዘለዉ ናይ COVID-19 ጉዳያት ምስ ኣብ ጣልያን ዘለው ጉዳያት ኣወዳዲርና ኢና።
en-mt: We compared the COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK during the period from January 31- March 15 2020 with those in Italy.

sourceString: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: ናይ CoVID-19 ጉዳያት ለበዳ ኣብ ናይ EU/EEA ሃገራትን እንግሊዝን
en-mt: CoVID-19 cases outbreak in EU/EEA countries and the UK

sourceString: Subsequent to China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical spread and the dynamic of the COVID-19 pandemic in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.
targetString: ደድሕሪ ቻይና ድማ COVID-19 ኣብ ተወሳኽቲ ጂኦግራፊያዊ ዝርጋሐታት ዝካየደ እንትኾን፡ ኣብ መላዕ ዓለም ዝረኣይ ናይ COVID-19 ለበዳ ባህሪ ድማ ምስ እታ ሃገር ተመሳሳሊ ኣካይዳ እዩ ዘለዎ።
en-mt: Following China, COVID-19 has spread to additional geographical areas, and the nature of the global outbreak is similar to that of the country.

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.
targetString: ናይ ውድብ ጥዕና ዓለም (WHO) ዳይሬክተር ጀነራል ን COVID-19 ዓለም ለኻዊ ለበዳ ክብል ኣብ ማርች 11 2020 ኣዊጁ።
en-mt: The Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a global pandemic on March 11,

sourceString: In the 5 March issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases according to the WHO case definition.
targetString: ኣብ 5 ማርች 2020 ዝተኻየደ ናይ ዩሮሰርቬላንስ ኣኼባ Spiteri et al፣ ውድብ ጥዕና ዓለም(WHO) ዘዉጽኦ ናይ ጉዳይ ለበዳ ትርጉም ብምጥቃም ኣብ ኣውሮፓ ንዝተረኽቡ ናይ መጀመርታ ናይ COVID-19 ጉዳያት ለበዳ ኣፍሊጡ እዩ።
en-mt: At the Eurosurveillance meeting on 5 March 2020, Spiteri et al, announced the first COVID-19 cases in Europe using the World Health Organization (WHO) case definition.

sourceString: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in persons returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: ኣብ EU/EEA፡ እቶም ናይ መጀመሪያ ዝተረጋገጹ ሰለስተ ኣብ ካብ ዉሃን፡ ሁበይ ግዝኣት. ቻይና ዝተመለሱ ሰባት ዝተርኣዩ ሰባት ብ ፍራንስ 24 ኣብ ጃኑዋሪ 2020 ተጽብጺቦም እዮም።
en-mt: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases in from Wuhan, Hubei Province. The sightings of people returning to China were reported by France 24 in January

sourceString: As at 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), whereby between 31 December 2019 and that date included, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.
targetString: ኣብ 15 ማርች 2020 ናይ COVID-19 ጉዳያት ለበዳ ኣብ ኩለን እተን 30 ናይ EU/EEA ሃገራትን ኣብ ዩናይትድ ኪንግደምን (UK) ከምዝተረኸበ ይግለፅ። ካብ 31 ዲሰምበር 2019 ጀሚሩ ክሳብ እቲ ዕለት ድማ 39,768 ጉዳያት ለበዳን 1,727 ሞትን ተመዝጊቦም እዮም። ካብዚኦም ድማ እቶም 17,750 ጉዳያት ለበዳ 1,441 ሞትን ካብ ጣልያን ጥራሕ እዮም ተረኺቦም።
en-mt: On 15 March 2020, outbreak cases of COVID-19 were reported in all 30 EU/EEA countries and in the United Kingdom (UK). Since December 31, 2019, 39,768 outbreak cases and 1,727 deaths have been registered. Of these, 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths were reported from Italy alone.

sourceString: Obtaining cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases
targetString: ናይ COVID-19 ኬዛት ድምር ቁፅርን ድምር ክስተትን ምርካብ
en-mt: Get the total number of COVID-19 cases and total incidence

sourceString: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the notified COVID-19 case counts in each country worldwide, obtained from only official sources such as the countries’ Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities and the WHO, are updated each day at 8:00 a.m.
targetString: ኣብ European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) (ናይ ኣዎሮፓ ሕማም ናይ መከላኸሊን መቆፃፀርን ማእኸል) ናይ ሕድሕድ ናይ ዓለም ሃገራት COVID-19 ስሩዕ መረዳእታ ካብ ዝህቡ ምንጭታት ከም ናይ ጥዕና ሚኒስቴር፣ ብሄራዊን ክልላዊን ናይ ጥዕና ምምሕዳር ከምኡዉን ካብ ውድብ ጥዕና ዓለም(WHO) ዝተወስደ መረዳእታ ብምጥቃም ኩሉ ጊዜ ንግሆ ሰዓት 8፡00 ዝመሓየሽ እዩ።
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) provides regular COVID-19 data for each country in the world from sources such as the Ministry of Health, national and regional health administrations and the World Health Organization (WHO). ) is updated every morning at 8:00 am using retrieved data.

sourceString: These data were used for assessing the trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and the UK, and comparing them to that in Italy.
targetString: እዞም ዳታታት እዚኦም ኣብ EU/EEAን ኣብ እንግሊዝን ዘሎ ምዕባለታት COVID-19 ዳህሳስ ብምግባር ምስ ጣልያን ንምንጽጻር ኣብ ጥቕሚ ዝወዓለ እዩ።
en-mt: These data were used to survey COVID-19 developments in the EU/EEA and the UK and compare them with Italy.

sourceString: As a proxy of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, during the 1 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: ካብ 1 ጃኑዋሪ-15 ማርች 2020 ዘሎ እዋን ኣብ ሕድሕድ ሃገራት EU/EEAን UKን ንCOVID-19 ጉዳያት ለበዳ ክዉክል ዝኽእል ናይ COVID-19 ተፈጥሮኣዊ ጉዕዞ ኣብ ሓሳብ ብምእታው ናይ 14-መዓልቲ ዝተቆረፀ COVID-19 ጉዳያት ለበዳ ድምር ኣስሊሕና ኢና።
en-mt: From 1 January-15 March 2020, we calculated the 14-day cut-off sum of COVID-19 cases in each EU/EEA and UK, taking into account the natural journey of COVID-19 cases that may represent the cases.

sourceString: We also presented the cumulative number of notified cases of each country as at 15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. compared with that of Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: ምስ ካብ 31 ጃንዋሪ-15 ማርች 2020 ዘሎ ናይ ጣልያን ቁፅሪ ኣነፃፂርካ ኣብ 15 መጋቢት 2020 ንጉሆ ሰዓት 8፡00 ዝተገልፀ ናይ ሕድሕድ ሃገር ድምር ኣቕሪብና ኣለና።
en-mt: We have presented the country-by-country totals as of 8:00 am on 15 March 2020 compared to the Italian figures for 31 January-15 March

sourceString: Trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: ናይ CoVID-19 ምዕባለታት ኣብ ሃገራት EU/EEAን Ukን
en-mt: CoVID-19 developments in EU/EEA and Uk countries

sourceString: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed that of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).
targetString: ድሕሪ ናይ ቻይና ሁባይ ቐጠና ኣብ EU/EEA ሃገራትን UKን ዝተርኣዩ ናይ 14 መዓልታት ናይ COVID-19 ልውጥታት (Figure 1)
en-mt: 14-day COVID-19 changes in EU/EEA countries and UK after China's Hubei region (Figure 1)

sourceString: For the EU/EEA and the UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).
targetString: ን EU/EEAን ን እንግሊዝን በጠቓላሊ፡ እቲ ውህሉል ናይ COVID-19 ኣጋጣሚታት ካብ ፌብሩዋሪ 21 ንደሓር እዩ ክውስኽ ጀሚሩ፡ ቀጺሉ ድማ ካብ ፌብሩዋሪ 28:2020 ንደሓር ብ ናህሪ ወሲኹ እዩ(ተሓጋጋዚ ናውቲታት)።
en-mt: For the EU/EEA and the UK as a whole, the cumulative COVID-19 cases started to increase after 21 February and continued to increase rapidly after 28 February 2020(supporting materials).

sourceString: This was mostly driven by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increasing trends of the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).
targetString: እዚ መብዛሕቲኡ ግዜ ካብ ጣልያን ብዝጽብጸቡ ዓብዪ ናህሪ ዝነበሮም ወሳኸታት ዝዝወር እዩ ነይሩ፡ ነገር ግን ኩለን ዝተረፋ ናይ EU/EEA ሃገራትን እንግሊዝን ተመሳሳሊ ናይ ወሰኽ ምዕባለታት ውህሉል ናይ COVID-19 ኣጋጣሚታት ኣርኢየን እየን።
en-mt: This was often driven by the largest increases reported from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increases in cumulative COVID-19 cases.

sourceString: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared with that in Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: ኣሃዝ 2 ምስ ካብ 31 ጃንዋሪ- 15 ማርች 2020 ዝነበረ ናይ ጣልያን ጉዳያት ለበዳ ብምንፅፃር ኣብ ሃገራት EU/EEAን UKን ዝርከቡ ድምር ጉዳያት ለበዳ COVID-19 ዘርኢ እዩ።
en-mt: Figure 2 shows the total number of COVID-19 cases in the EU/EEA and UK compared to the Italian cases from 31 January- 15 March

sourceString: It highlights that, as at 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to that of Italy just 3 weeks prior or less.
targetString: ኣብ 15 ማርች ናይ ንግሆ ሳዓት 8፡00 ምስ ቅድሚ 3 ሰሙን ዝተመዝገበ ናይ ጣልያን በዝሒ ጉዳያት ለበዳ ዝነፃፀር ቁፅሪ ኣብ 15 ሃገራት EU/EEAን UKን ተመዝጊቡ ኣሎ።
en-mt: As of 8:00 am on March 15, 15 EU/EEA and UK cases have been reported, compared to Italy's three weeks ago.

sourceString: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: ዘለዉና ውጽኢታት ዝተፈለጡ ጉዳያት COVID-19 ኣብ EU/EEAን እንግሊዝን ብ ቕልጡፍ እናወሰኹ ከምዝኾኑ ዘርእዩ እዮም።
en-mt: Our results show that known cases of COVID-19 are increasing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.

sourceString: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is progressing at a comparable speed in all countries.
targetString: እቲ ዝረአ ዘሎ ጠቕላላ ናይ COVID-19 ክስተት እቲ ለበዳ ኣብ ኩለን ሃገራት ብተነፃፃሪ ፍጥነት ከምዝስፋሕፋሕ ዘሎ ዘረድእ እዩ።
en-mt: The total incidence of COVID-19 indicates that the epidemic is spreading at a relatively rapid pace in all countries.

sourceString: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients that must be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including catch-up testing.
targetString: እዚ ድማ ኣንጻር እተን ሃገራት ኣብ ዝተፈላለየ ደረጃ ዘለዋ ይኹና፡ ኣብ ናይ ብሄራዊ ህዝባዊ ጥዕና ዘሎ ኣፈላላይ፡ ኣብ ዝተፈላለዩ ሃገራት ክህሉ ዝኽእል ዝተፈላለየ ናይ ጉዳያት ትርጉም ኣዋህባን፡ን ናይ COVID-19 ምርመራ ብቑዓት ዝኾኑ ሕሙማት ኣብ ምምራጽ ዝስዕቡዎ ዝተፈላለየ ፕሮቶኮላት እዩ።
en-mt: This is against the differences in national public health status, the differences in case interpretation that may exist in different countries, and the different protocols followed in selecting patients eligible for COVID-19 testing.

sourceString: Early March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation in which ca 10% of patients with COVID-19 required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had already reached their maximum capacity.
targetString: ኣብ መጅመሪ ማርች 2020፡ኣብ እተን በዚ ረኽሲ ዝተጠቕዓን ኣብ ካልኦት ኣብ ጣልያን ዝርከባ ክልላት ዘለው ዶክተራት፡ ነቲ ዘሎ ኩነታት፡ማለት እውን ካብቶም ናይ COVID-19 ሕሙማት ውሽጢ 10% ኢድ ዝኾኑ ጽኑዕ ሕክምና ዝደልዩ እዮም፡ ሚድያታታት ከምዝዘገባኦ ድማ፡ እተን ኣብዚ ክልል ዝርከባ ናይ ጽኑዕ ሕክምና ክትትል ክፍሊታት እቲ ክሕዛኦ ዝኽእላ ወሰን ብርኪ በጺሐን ኣለዋ።
en-mt: In early March 2020, doctors in the affected and other regions in Italy were seeking intensive treatment for the current situation, that is, within 10% of the COVID-19 patients, media reported that the Intensive treatment monitoring fees have reached the limit of what they can handle.

sourceString: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases in a hospital and/or an intensive care unit are currently available at EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% cases, respectively (data not shown).
targetString: ኣብ እዚ ሐዚ እዋን ብ ደረጃ EU/EEA ዘሎ ናይ COVID-19 ቅበላ ዳታ ኣብ ሆስፒታል 6% ኣብ ጽኑዕ ክንክን ድማ 1% ዝርከብ እዩ(ዳታ ኣይቀረበን)።
en-mt: Current EU/EEA-level COVID-19 admission data are 6% in hospital and 1% in intensive care (data not available).

sourceString: They should, however, be collected in a systematic fashion to complement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.
targetString: ኣብ ዝተመዝገቡ ቁፅሪ ጉዳያት ለበዳ ሞትን ምስ ዘድህብ ምርምር ንምስምዕማዕ ብስትራቴጂካዊ መንገዲ ክእከቡ ይግባእ።
en-mt: They should be clustered strategically to align with research that focuses on the number of recorded cases and epidemiological mortality.

sourceString: A study performed in 2010–11 showed a large variation in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.
targetString: ኣብ 2010–11 ኣብ ዝተገበረ መፅናዕቲ፣ ኣብ ኣውሮፓ ናይ ጽኑዕ ክንክንን ናይ ማእኸላይ ክንክን ዓራት ህላወ ካብ 29.2 ኣብ ጀርመን ናብ 4.2 ን100,000 ህዝቢ ኣብ ፖርቹጋል ዝኾን ዓብዪ ፍልልይ ከምዘሎ ኣርእዩ እዩ።
en-mt: In a 2010–11 survey, the availability of acute care and intermediate care beds in Europe showed a large difference from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 per 100,000 population in Portugal.

sourceString: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).
targetString: እዚ ማለት ድማ ሃገራት ካብ ጣልያን (12.5 ጽኑዕ ክንክን ማእኸለዋይ ክንክን ዓራታት ብ 100000 በዝሒ ህዝቢ ኣብ 2010-11) ንላዕሊ ወይድማ ዝነኣሰ ናይ ሃብቲ መጠን ክህልወን ይኽእል እዩ።
en-mt: This means that countries may have more or less wealth than Italy (12.5 intensive care beds per 100,000 population in 2010-11).

sourceString: Modelling scenarios related to healthcare capacity saturation, with estimates for each EU/EEA country and the UK of the prevalence of hospitalised COVID-19 cases associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.
targetString: ምስ ናይ ወሰን ዓቕሚ ክንክን ጥዕና ዝተሓሓዙ ናይ ሞደል ተርእዮታት፣ ምስ ሕድሕድ ናይ EU/EEA ሃገራትን እንግሊዝን ዝህሉ ናይ ምስ a &gt ዝተሓሓዙ ኣብ ሆስፒታል ዝርከቡ ናይ COVID-19 ጉዳያት ለበዳ ትንቢት ዝሓዘ፣ 90% ዝኾን ናይ ጽኑዕ ክንክን ዓራት ዓቕሚ ናይ ምሓልፉ ሓደጋ፣ ኣብ እቲ መበል ሻዱሻይ ዝተሓደሰ ናይ ECDC ናይ COVID-19 ቅልጡፍ ናይ ሓደጋ ዳህሳስ ቀሪቡ እዩ።
en-mt: Model phenomena associated with marginal healthcare capacity, with a prediction of the outbreak of a > related in-hospital COVID-19 cases with each EU/EEA country and the UK, containing a 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, in The sixth updated ECDC COVID-19 Rapid Risk Assessment has been released.

sourceString: Since cases have so far clustered in certain regions in EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve a defined regional catchment population, information about cases and intensive care beds should preferably be made available at the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.
targetString: ኣብ ሓደሓደ ናይ EU/EEA ሀገራትን እንግሊዝን ውሽጢ ኣብ ዝተወሰኑ ክልላት ዝርከቡ ሕክምናታትን ናይ ጽኑዕ ክንክን ዩኒታት ኣገልግሎት ንካብ ውስን ክፍሊ እቲ ቀጠና ዝመጹ ሰባት ኣገልግሎት ዝህቡ እንትኾኑ ን ሕሙማን፣ ዓራት መረዳእታ ኣብ ዝተመደቡ ናይ ክልል ክፍሊ ንስታቲስቲክስ 2 (NUTS-2) ደረጃ ክርከብ ይግባእ።
en-mt: In some EU/EEA countries and the UK, treatments and intensive care units in certain regions provide services to people from a limited part of the region.

sourceString: The experience from Italy and the current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: ካብ ጣልያንን ኣብ ካልኦት ዓዲታት ዝተወሰዱ ካልኦት እዋናዊ ምዕባለታት ዝተረኸበ ተሞክሮ ከምዘርእዮ ናይ COVID-19 ለበዳ ኣብ EU/EEA ን ኣብ እንግሊዝን ብ ናህሪ እናዓበየ ይርከብ።
en-mt: Experience from Italy and other recent developments in other countries shows that the COVID-19 epidemic is growing rapidly in the EU/EEA and in the UK.

sourceString: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for a scenario of sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of patients with COVID-19 requiring healthcare, and in particular intensive care, such as the one occurring in the affected regions of Italy.
targetString: ሃገራት፣ ሕክምናታትን ላዕለዋይ ሓገዝ ዝህቡ ክፍልታትን ነቲ ክመፅእ ዝኽእል ቀፃሊ ዝኾነ ናይ SARS-CoV-2 ለበዳን ከምኡውን ቁፅሪ ብCOVID-19 ዝተጠቕዑ ብምዉሳኽ ጥዕና ሓለዋን ከም ኣብቶም ዝተጎድኡ ክፋላት ጣልያን ዘለዉ ላዕለዋይ ሓገዝ ዘድልዮም ቦታታትን ክህልዉ ስለዝኽእሉ ኣድላዪ ምድላው ክግበር ይግባእ።
en-mt: Countries, treatments and paramedic departments should be prepared for the possible ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak and the increase in the number of cases of COVID-19 in health care and paramedic areas such as those in the affected parts of Italy.

sourceString: As pointed out in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the anticipated rapid increase in the number of cases may not provide decision makers and hospitals enough time to comprehend, accept and adapt their response accordingly if not implemented ahead of time.
targetString: ኣብ ቀረባ እዋን ዝወፀ ናይ ECDC ስሉጥ ናይ ሓደጋ ምርመራ ቅልጡፍ፣ ህፁፅን ኣጠቓላሊን ዝኾነ ኣቀራርባ ብምጥቃም ምትሕልላፍ SARS-COV-2 ምቕናስ ከምዝከኣል ሓቢሩ።ካብ ምዕጋት ናብ ምቕናስ ብምቕያር ዝግበር ኣከይዳ ቀዲምካ እንተዘይተተሊሙ ነቲ ዝፅበየና ዘሎ ቅልጡፍ ናይ ጉዳያት ለበዳ ምዉሳኽ ዉሳነ ወሃብትን ሕክምናታትን ግቡእ ዝኾነ መልሲ ክህቡ ኣይኽእሉን።
en-mt: The recent ECDC Efficient Risk Assessment stated that the transmission of SARS-COV-2 can be reduced by using a fast, urgent and comprehensive approach They cannot give.

sourceString: The rapid risk assessment also lists the public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.
targetString: ቅልጡፍ ናይ ሓደጋ ግምገማ ናይ እቲ ለበዳ ፅዕንቶ ንክቕንስ ናይ ህዝቢ ጥዕና ስጉምትታት እውን ይዝርዝር እዩ።
en-mt: A rapid risk assessment also lists public health measures to reduce the impact of the outbreak.

sourceString: There is a short window of opportunity during which countries have the possibility to further increase their control efforts to slow down the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and decrease the pressure on healthcare.
targetString: ሃገራት ናይ SARS-CoV-2 ዝርጋሐ ኣብ ምግታእን ኣብ ናይ ጥዕና ክንክን ዘሎ ጸቕጢ ኣብ ምቕናስን ዘለዎን ቁጽጽር ብዝበለጸ ክውስኻሉ ዝኽእላሉ ሓጺር ናይ ዕድል መሽኮት ኣለወን።
en-mt: Countries have a short window of opportunity in which they can best increase the control it has on curbing the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and reducing the pressure on health care.

sourceString: Failing this, it is likely that the healthcare systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a surge of patients that require intensive care within the coming days or weeks.
targetString: እዚ ምግባር ተዘይተኻኢሉ ኣብ ካልኦት EU/EEA ሃገራት ኣብ ዉሽጢ ተወሰነ ማዓልትታት ወይድማ ሰሙናት እቲ ጥዕና ሓለዋ ላዕለዋይ ሓገዝ ዘድልዮም ሕሙማት ምወሳኽ ከጋጥሞም ይኽእል እዩ።
en-mt: If this is not done, other EU/EEA countries may experience an increase in the number of patients in need of high-level health care within a few days or weeks.

sourceString: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has thus far killed over 3,000 people and infected over 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in catastrophe for humans.
targetString: እቲ ብ SARS ኮረና ቫይረስ 2 (SARS-CoV-2) ዝተበገሰ ናይ 2019 (COVID-19) ናይ ኮረና ቫይረስ ለበዳ፡እስካብ ሐዚ ካብ 3000 ንላዕሊ ሰባት ብምቕታል እስካብ 80000 ዝኾኑ ድማ ኣጥቂዑ ይርከብ፡ ኣብ ካልኦት ክፋላት ዓለማት ድማ ኣስክሕካሒ ህልቂት እናስዓበ ይርከብ።
en-mt: The 2019 (COVID-19) coronavirus pandemic, triggered by SARS coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has so far killed more than 3,000 people and infected up to 80,000, and is causing horrific deaths in other parts of the world.

sourceString: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 might also be transmitted from the bats and causes similar symptoms through a similar mechanism.
targetString: ልክዕ ከም እቲ ኣብ 2003 ኣብ ኣሽሓት ሰባት SARS ዘኸተለ SARS-CoV፣ SARS-CoV-2 እዉን ብተመሳሳሊ መንገዲ ካብ ሎኻኺቶ ተመሓላሊፉ ተመሳሳሊ ምልክታት ከምፅእ ይኽእል እዩ።
en-mt: Like SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 can be transmitted from locusts in a similar way and cause similar symptoms.

sourceString: However, COVID-19 has lower severity and mortality than SARS but is much more transmissive and affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women.
targetString: ይኹን ደኣምበር COVID-19 ካብ SARS ዝነኣሰ መጠን ሞት እንትህልዎ ዝበኣሰ ናይ ምምሕልላፍን ካብ መናእሰይ ንላዕሊ ዓበይቲ፣ ካብ ደቂ ኣንስትዮ ንላዕሊ ደቂ ተባዕትዮ ዘጥቅዕ እዩ።
en-mt: However, COVID-19 has a lower mortality rate than SARS and is more transmissible and affects more adults than young people, and more men than women.

sourceString: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on the emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of the swiftly developing research subject.
targetString: ነቶም ኣዝዮም እናወሰኹ ዝኸዱ ዘለው ናይ ሓደሽቲ ሕማማት ሕትመታት መልሲ ኣብ ምሃብ፡ እዚ ኣንቀጽ እዚ ነቲ ብቕልጡፍ እና ማዕበለ ዝኸድ ዘሎ ናይ ምርምር ፕሮጀክት፡ ግዜኡ ዝሓለወን ሓቛፊ ዝኾነን ኣጠቓላሊ ርኢቶ ንምሃብ ፈተነ ዝገበር እዩ።
en-mt: In response to the increasing number of new disease publications, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive overview of the rapidly evolving research project.

sourceString: We will cover the basics about the epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of the disease.
targetString: ብዛዕባ ኢፒዲሞሎጂ(epidemiology)፡ ኢቲዮሎጂ(etiology)፡ ቫይሮሎጂ(virology)፡ ምርመራታት፡ ሕክምና፡ ፕሮጅኖሲስ(prognosis)ን ናይ እቲ ሕማም መከላኸሊን ዝምልከት መሰረታውያን ጉዳያት ክንሽፍን ኢና።
en-mt: We will cover basic issues about epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnoses, treatment, prognosis and prevention of the disease.

sourceString: Although many questions still require answers, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of the threatening disease.
targetString: ብዙሓት ሕቶታት መልሲ ዝደልዩ እኳ እንተኾኑ፡ እዚ ኣጠቓላሊ መግለጺ እዚ ነዚ መስካሕክሒ ሕማም ኣብ ምርዳእን ምውጋድን ሓገዝ ከምዝገብር ተስፋ ንገብር።
en-mt: While many questions remain to be answered, we hope this overview will help in understanding and avoiding this terrible disease.

sourceString: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory to all Chinese who were urged to stay indoors for all the holiday and for many weeks after due to the outbreak of a novel viral disease.
targetString: ኣብ 25 ጃኑዋሪ 2020 ዝኽበር ናይ Spring Festival( ፅድያ ባዓል) በቲ ለበዳ ሓድሽ ቫይረስ ምኽንያት ብምግባር ኣብ እቲ እዋን ኣውዳኣመትን ንቀፃሊ ሰሙናት ካብ ገዛ ንከይወፁን ንዝተገብሩ መላእ ቻይናዉያን ተራእዩ ዘይፈልጥን ዘይትርሳዕን ማዓልቲ ኮይና ከምዝሓለፈት ይእመን።
en-mt: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 is believed to have been an unprecedented and unforgettable day for all Chinese who were forced to stay indoors during the New Year and the coming weeks due to the outbreak of the new virus.

sourceString: The virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; thus, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the associated disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
targetString: እቲ ቫይረስ ምስ እቲ ኣብ 2003 ለበዳ ዘስዓበ SARS ኮረና ቫይረስ ዝዓበየ ተመሳስሊነት ዘለዎ እዩ፡ በዚ ድማ ኣብ ፌብሩዋሪ 11:2020 ብ ውድብ ጥዕና ዓለም SARS-CoV-2 ተባሂሉ ክጽዋዕ ዝኸኣለ እንትኾን ምስ ዝተተሓሓዘ ሕማም ድማ ኮቭ ሕማም-19(ኮቪድ-19) ተባሂሉ እዩ።
en-mt: The virus has the greatest similarity to the SARS coronavirus that caused the 2003 pandemic, thus it was designated SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization on February 11:2020 and the associated disease as CoV disease-19(COVID-19). is.

sourceString: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread throughout the entire country and to near 50 others all over the world.
targetString: እቲ ለበዳ ኣብ ዉሃን ቻይና ዝጀመረ እንትኸዉን ቀልጢፉ ድማ ናብ መላእ እታ ሃገርን ናብ ካልኦት ከባቢ 50 ሃገራትን ተላቢዱ እዩ።
en-mt: The outbreak began in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread across the country and to about 50 other countries.

sourceString: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in over 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and over 3,000 patients who died.
targetString: ክሳብ ማርች 2, 2020 እቲ ቫይረስ 80,000 ዝተረጋገፁ ናይ COVID-19 ጉዳያት ለበዳ ከምዘለዉ ፣ ልዕሊ 40,000 ሕሙማት ካብ ሕክምና ከምዝወፁን ከምኡውን 3,000 ሕሙማት ከምዝሞቱን ይፍለጥ።
en-mt: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19 , more than 40,000 patients have been discharged and 3,000 patients have died.

sourceString: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and potentially more powerful than terrorism.
targetString: COVID-19 ‘’ናይ ህዝቢ ቀዳማይ ፀላኢ 1’’ ከምዝኾነን ካብ ግብረ ሽበራ ዝሓየለ ምዃኑን ውድብ ጥዕና ዓለም (WHO) ኣጠንቂቑ ኣሎ።
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) has warned that COVID-19 is ''people's first enemy 1'' and is stronger than terrorism.

sourceString: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, over 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from multiple patients.
targetString: ካብ ብዙሓት ሕሙማት ዝተወስዱ ናይ ቫይረስ ቅደም ሳዓብ ካብ ዝወፀሉ 7 ጃኑዋሪ 2020 እዋን ጀሚሩ ብዛዕባ ናይ COVID-19 ቫይሮሎጂ፣ ኢፒደሞሎጂ፣ ኢትዮሊጂ፣ ናይ ምርመራ ከይዲን መድሓኒትን ክልተ ወርሒ ኣብ ዘይመልአ እዋን ልዕሊ 200 ፅሑፋት ተሓቲሞም ይብል PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/)
en-mt: Since the release of viral sequences from many patients on January 7, 2020, more than 200 articles have been published on the virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnostic process and treatment of COVID-19 in less than two months, according to PubMed (https://www.ncbi. nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/)

sourceString: This review attempts to summarize the research progress in the new and swiftly developing subject area.
targetString: እዚ ክለሳ ኣብ እቲ ሓድሽን ብቕልጡፍን ዝዓቢ ዘሎ ርእሰ ጉዳይ ናይ መፅናዕቲ ትምበያ ንምጥቕላል ይፍትን።
en-mt: This review attempts to summarize the research forecast on the new and rapidly growing subject.

sourceString: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-caused disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, an outbreak in 2012).
targetString: ኣብዝተኽኣለና ጊዜ COVID-19 ምስ SARSን ካልኦት CoV-caused ሕማማት፣ MERS( ኣብ 2012 ዝተልዓለ ለበዳ) ንምንጽጻር ክንሙክር ኢና።
en-mt: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and other CoV-caused diseases, MERS( the 2012 outbreak).

sourceString: We will also discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and prognosis of the disease as well as some remaining yet urgent questions.
targetString: ብዛዕባ ናይ እቲ ሕማም መከላኸሊን ትንበያታትን ብዛዕባ ገለ ዝቕርዩ ህጹጻት ሕቶታትን እስካብ ሐዚ እንታይ ክምዝተዛተናን እውን ክንመያየጥ ኢና።
en-mt: We will also discuss the prevention and forecasts of the disease, some urgent questions that remain, and what we have discussed so far.

sourceString: CoVs have been traditionally considered nonlethal pathogens to humans, mainly causing approximately 15% of common colds 4.
targetString: CoVs ብ ልሙድ ን ደቂ-ሳብት ናብ ሞት ዘይብቅዑ ተባሂሎም እዮም ዝውሰዱ፡ ብ ጽግግዕ 15% ዝኸውን ናይ ጉንፋዕ ጸገም ዘብጽሑ እዮም 4።
en-mt: CoVs are commonly considered non-lethal in children, causing approximately 15% of flu cases

sourceString: However, in this century, we have encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs twice, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused an outbreak originally in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with horrible morbidity and mortality.
targetString: ኮይኑ ግና ኣብ እዚ ክፍለዘመን ኣብ ቻይና ብ2003ን ኣብ ስዑድ ዓረብ ድማ ብ2012ን ዘጋጠሙ ዳሓር ድማ ናብ ዝተፈላለዩ ሃገራት ብምስፍሕፋሕ ከቢድ ሕማምን ሞትን ዘስዐቡ ብተኸታታሊ SARS-CoVን MERS-CoVን ዝተብሃሉ ናይ CoVs ክልተ ሕማማት ኣጋጢሞም እዮም።
en-mt: However, this century saw two outbreaks of CoVs, SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which occurred in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012 and then spread to various countries, causing serious illness and death.

sourceString: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.
targetString: ስለዚ፡ እዚ እዋናዊ COVID-19 ኣብ ናይ ደቂ-ሰባት ታሪኽ እቲ ሳልሳይ ኮይኑ ዝተመዝገበ ናይ CoV ለበዳ እዩ።
en-mt: Therefore, this current COVID-19 is the third recorded CoV outbreak in human history.

sourceString: As shown in Fig. ​Fig.1,1, clusters of pneumonia that had unknown origins were first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.
targetString: ኣብ ​Fig.1.1 ከምዝተርኣየ ኣብ ዲሰምበር 31:2019 ዘይተፈልጠ ምንጪ ዘለዎም ናይ ሳንቡእ ወቕዒ ጉጅለታት ንመጀመሪያ ጊዜ ካብ ዉሃን ናብ ቻይና ብሄራዊ ናይ ጥዕና ኮሚሽን ጸብጽብ ቀሪቡ እዩ።
en-mt: As shown in Fig.1.1, on December 31, 2019, the first cases of pneumonia of unknown origin were reported to the National Health Commission of China from Wuhan.

sourceString: Seven days later the sequence of the CoV was released.
targetString: ድሕሪ ሸዉዓተ ማዓልትታት ናይ CoV ቅደም ሰዓብ ተገሊፁ።
en-mt: Eight days later, the CoV sequence was determined.

sourceString: On January 15, 2020 the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.
targetString: ኣብ ጃኑዋሪ 15:2020 እቲ ናይ መጀመሪያ ሞት ካብ ውሃን ተጸብጺቡ።
en-mt: On January 15:2020 the first death was reported from Wuhan.

sourceString: Meanwhile, the epidemic rapidly spread to the neighboring cities, provinces, and countries.
targetString: ኣብ መጨረሻ፡ እቲ ለበዳ ናብ ጎረባብቲ ከተማታት፡ ግዝኣታትን ሃገራትን ብ ናህሪ እናተጋፈሐ ይርከብ።
en-mt: Finally, the epidemic is spreading rapidly to neighboring cities, states, and countries.

sourceString: On January 20, the infection of health-care providers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was possible.
targetString: ኣብ ጃኑዋሪ 20፡ ናይ ጥዕና ክንክን ወሃብቲ በቲ ረኽሲ ምጥቃዕ ተጸብጺቡ ነይሩ፡ እዚ ድማ ካብ ሰባት ናብ ሰባት ከምዝመሓላለፍ ዝጠቆመ እዩ ነይሩ።
en-mt: On January 20, health care providers were reported infected with the infection, indicating that it was transmitted from person to person.

sourceString: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with all its public transportation stopped.
targetString: ኣብ ጃኑዋሪ 23, ከተማ ዉሃን መላእ ናይ ህዝቢ መጎዓዝያ ጠጠው ብምባል ተዓጽያ ነይራ።
en-mt: On January 23, Wuhan was closed to all public transportation.

sourceString: On January 24 the first clinical study on the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered the starting site of the infection from an unknown animal source.
targetString: ምስ እቲ ሕማም ካብ ዘይተፈልጠ እንስሳ ከምዝተጀመረሉ ዝሕሰብ ዉሃን ዕዳጋ መሸጢ ናይ ባሕሪ እንስሳ ቀጥታዊ ርክብ ዝነበሮም ካብቶም ዝተረጋገፁ 41 ሕሙማት እቶም 21 ጥራሕ ከምዝኾኑ ኣብ 24 ጃኑዋሪ ዝተገብረ ፈላማይ ክሊኒካዊ መፅናዕቲ ገሊፁ።
en-mt: Only 21 of the 41 confirmed cases had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market, where the disease is thought to have started from an unknown animal, according to the first clinical study conducted on January

sourceString: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
targetString: ውድብ ጥዕና ዓለም(WHO) ኣብ ጃንዋሪ 30 ነቲ ለበዳ ዓለምለኸ ሃንደበታዊ ሓደጋ ብምባል ኣዊጁ።
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared the outbreak a global emergency on January

sourceString: By the time of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and near 50 other countries all over the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).
targetString: እብ እዋን ናይ እዚ ጽብጻብ፡ እቲ ለበዳ ኣብ መላእ ቻይናን ኣብ መላእ ዓለም ኣብ ካልኦት ናብ 50 ዝጽግዑ ሀገራት ተዘርጊሑ ይርከብ (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2)።
en-mt: At the time of this report, the outbreak has spread throughout China and to nearly 50 other countries worldwide (Fig. ​ (Fig.2).2).

sourceString: As the situation is rapidly evolving, the final scope and severity of the outbreak remain to be determined.
targetString: እቲ ኩነታት ብቕልጡፍ እናማዕበለ ብምኻዱ ናይ እቲ ለበዳ ወሰን ክግመት ኣይከኣልን።
en-mt: The situation is developing rapidly and the extent of the outbreak cannot be predicted.

sourceString: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study on 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients presented a more updated illustration of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
targetString: ኣብ ፌብሩዋሪ 11:2020፡ ኣብ 4021 ዝተረጋገጸ ናይ COVID-19 ጉዳይ ዘልዎም ሕሙማት ዘጠቓለለ ሓዊሱ ኣብ 8866 ሕሙማት ዝተገበረ በዓል ብዙሕ ማእኸል ጽንዓት ብዛዕባ እቲ ለበዳ ዝሓሸ መግለጺ ከምዚ ዝስዕብ ኣሐዲሱ ኣቕሪቡ ኣሎ (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA)።
en-mt: On February 11:2020, a multicenter study of 8866 patients, including 4021 confirmed cases, updated the following better description of the outbreak (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s). /UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly at the age of 30-65.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ንኩሉ ናይ ዕድመ ክልል ዘጥቅዕ እንትኾን ብ በዝሒ ካብ 30-65 ዓመት ንዘልዉ እዩ ዘጥቅዕ።
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 affects all age groups, most commonly those aged 30-6

sourceString: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected individuals were over 50 years old, very few were under 20, and only 14 infected individuals were under the age of 10.
targetString: እቶም ዝተጠቕዑ ሕሙማት ኣስታት ፍርቂ (47.7%) ዝኾኑ ዕድሚኦም ልዕሊ 50 እንትኾኑ ዝተወሰኑ ድማ ትሕቲ 20 ዕድመ ዘለዎምን 14 ሕሙማት ድማ ትሕቲ 10 ዓመት እዮም።
en-mt: About half (47.7%) of the affected patients were over 50 years of age, some were under 20 years of age and 14 patients were under 10 years of age.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ዝበዝሑ ኣወዳት(0.31/100,000) ካብ ደቂ-ኣንስትዮ(0.27/100,000) ኣጥቂዑ እዩ።
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 affected more boys(0.31/100,000) than girls(0.27/100,000).

sourceString: COVID-19 expanded in clusters mainly in and around Hubei.
targetString: COVID-19 ኣብ ውሽጢ ሁበይን ከባቢኣን ብ ጉጅለ እዩ ተዛሚቱ።
en-mt: COVID-19 has spread in and around Hubei in groups.

sourceString: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.
targetString: COVID-19 ሕማም ካብ ዝጀመረሉ ክሳብ ዲያግኖሲስ ብማእኸላይ 5 (2-9) ማዓልትታት ይወስድ።
en-mt: COVID-19 takes an average of 5 (2-9) days from the onset of illness to diagnosis.

sourceString: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.
targetString: እቲ ማእኸለዋይ ናይ መፍልፈሊ ጊዜ 4.8 (3.0-7.2) መዓልቲታት እዩ።
en-mt: The mean incubation period is 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.

sourceString: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.
targetString: እቲ ካብ ዝጅምረሉ እዋን ክሳብ ሞት ብማእኸላይ 9.5 (4.8-13) ማዓልቲታት ይወስድ
en-mt: The average time from onset to death is 9.5 (4.8-13) days

sourceString: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.
targetString: እቲ መሰረታዊ ናይ ምፍራይ ቁጽሪ(R0) 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05) ክኸውን እንከሎ እቲ ዝተስተኻኸለ R0 2.23-4.82 እዩ።
en-mt: The baseline reproductive coefficient(R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05) while the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.

sourceString: The number of infected people increased exponentially before 23 Jan. 2020, matching the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.
targetString: ብምኽንያት ናይ ቻይና ናይ Spring Festival (ጸደይ በዓል) ኣብ ዝነበረ ጽዑቕ ምጉዑዓዝ ኣብ ጃኑዋሪ 23, 2020 በቲ ሕማም ዝተትሓዙ ሰባት ቑጽሪ ብሓይሊ ወሲኹ እዩ።
en-mt: The number of cases rose sharply on January 23, 2020, during the rush hour of China's Spring Festival.

sourceString: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality of all the patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
targetString: ናይ ዝተረጋገፁ ጉዳያት ለበዳ ናይ ሞት መጠን 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%) እንትኸዉን ኣብ ኩሎም ሕሙማት ዝተስተኻኸለ ናይ ሞት መጠን ድማ 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%) እዩ።
en-mt: The outbreak mortality rate of confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%) and the adjusted mortality rate in all patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).

sourceString: Three major risk factors for COVID-19 were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.
targetString: እቶም ሰለስተ ኣገደስቲ ንCOVID-19 ዘቃልዑ ነገራት ፆታ (ወዲ ተባዕታይ)፣ ዕድመ (≥60) ከምኡውን ሓያል ናይ ሳንቡእ ወቕዒ እዮም።
en-mt: The three most important risk factors for COVID-19 are gender (male), age (≥60) and severe pneumonia.

sourceString: CoVs are a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses containing a single strand of sense RNA.
targetString: CoVs ናይ ሰንስ RNA ነፀላ ስትራንድ ዘለዎም ናይ ዓበይትን ኤንቨሎፕድን ቫይረሳት ንኡስ ስድራ እዩ።
en-mt: CoVs are a subfamily of adult and enveloped viruses with single stranded sense RNA.

sourceString: They can be divided into four genera, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.
targetString: ኣልፋ፣ ቤታ፣ ጋማን ደልታን ተባሂሎም ናብ ኣርባዕተ ጀነራ ይምቀሉ። ካብዚኦም ድማ ኣልፋን ቤታን-CoVs ንወድሰብ ከምዘጥቅዑ ይፍለጥ።
en-mt: They are divided into four genera: alpha, beta, gamma and delta. Of these, alpha and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.

sourceString: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane fusion occurs.
targetString: እቲ ኤንቨሎፕ ስፓይክ (S) ግላይኮፕሮቲን ምስ ናይ angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) (ኣንጂዮቴንሲን-ቀያሪ ኤንዛይም) ከምኡውን ምስ dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) ተቐበልቲ ብተኸታታሊ ንSARS-CoVን MERS-CoVን ይጣመር። ድሕሪ እዚ ድማ ናይ መምብሬን ምጥባቕ ይቕፅል።
en-mt: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein couples to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) receptors for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively. After this, membrane adhesion continues.

sourceString: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins forms virion-containing vesicles, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.
targetString: ናይ ቫይረስ RNA ጂኖም ወደ ሳይቶፕላዝም ይፍንው ፤ ናይ ቫይረስ ጂኖም ምስተራብሑ ጂኖሚክ RNA ብ ኢንቨሎፕ ግላይኮፕሮቲንን ናኖክካፕሲድ ፕሮቲንን ብሓባር ብምኻድ ምስ እቲ ቫይረስ ንምትሕውዋስ ምስ እቲ ናይ ፕላዝማ ሽፋን ይዋሃዱ።
en-mt: The viral RNA genome is secreted into the cytoplasm; Once viral genomes are replicated, genomic RNA is transported together by envelope glycoproteins and nanocapsid proteins to fuse with the plasma membrane to fuse with the virus.

sourceString: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.
targetString: እቲ ናይ መጀመሪያ ጀነቲካዊ ቅደም ሰዓብ SARS-CoV-2 ኣብ ጃኑዋሪ 10፡2020 እዩ ተጸብጺቡ።
en-mt: The first genetic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10:2

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the original site of the outbreak, the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ሓዱሽ ናይ beta-CoV ዓይነት ኮይኑ፡ ካብ እቲ መጀመሪያ እቲ ሕማም ዝተረኸብሉ ቦታ ናይ ሁናን ናይ ባሕሪ ምግቢ ዕዳጋ ዝተወሰዱ 10 ተኸታተልቲ መርኣያታት ውሽጢ 99.98% ናይ ጀነቲክ ምምስሳል ዘለዎ እዩ።
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is a new beta-CoV strain with 99.98% genetic similarity within 10 consecutive specimens taken from the Hunan seafood market, where the disease was first detected.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ካብ SaRS-CoV ንላዕሊ ምስ MERS-CoV ብጀነቲክስ ዝመሳሰል እዩ።
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is more genetically similar to MERS-CoV than SaRS-CoV.

sourceString: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium.
targetString: ብኤለክትሮን ማይክሮስኮፒ ናይ SARS-CoV-2 ደቀቕቲ ነገራት ኣብ ናይ ወዲ ሰብ መተንፈሲ ኣካል ኤፒቴሊየም ብ ኣልትራቲን ክፍልታት ይርከብ።
en-mt: Electron microscopy of SARS-CoV-2 particles in human respiratory epithelium in ultratin compartments.

sourceString: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.
targetString: ናይ ሰባት ACE2 ን SARS-CoV-2 ከምኡውን ን SARS-CoV ተቐበልቲ ኾይኖም ተረኺቦም ኣለዉ፡፡
en-mt: Human ACE2 have been found to be receptors for SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 more weakly than that of SARS-CoV, which is coincident with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.
targetString: ኮይኑ ግና ምስ SARS-CoV እንትነፃፀር ናይ SARS-CoV-2 S ፕሮቲን ምስ ናይ ሰብ ACE2 ዝላሕለሐ ጥምረት ኣለዎ። እዚ ድማ ምስ SARS-CoV እንትነፃፀር ናይ SARS-CoV-2 ቀሊል ሕማም ምስ ናይ ምምፃእ ፀባዩ ዝገጣጠም እዩ።
en-mt: However, compared to SARS-CoV, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 has weaker binding to human ACE2. This is consistent with the milder illness of SARS-CoV-2 compared to SARS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ብ ወይ f3b ዝተቐመጠ ሓድሽ ኖቭል ፕሮቲን ከምኡውን ብ orf8 ዝተሓብእ ፕሮቲን ክፍጠር ይኽእል እዩ፡፡
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 can be produced by a new novel protein encoded by either f3b as well as a secreted protein by orf8.

sourceString: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.
targetString: ናይ SARS-CoV-2 orf3b ኣብ ቫይራል ሕማም ናይ ምስዓብ ተኽእሎ ከምኡዉን ናይ IFNβ; ምህርቲ ኣብ ምዕጋት ዓቢ ግደ ይፃወት orf8 ግን ክሳብ ሕዚ ዝተፈልጠ ተግባራዊ ዶሜን ወይድማ ንድፊ የብሉን።
en-mt: the potential of SARS-CoV-2 orf3b to follow viral disease and that of IFNβ; It plays a major role in inhibiting production but orf8 has no known functional domain or design so far.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of the full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.
targetString: ኣብ 18 ፌብሩዋሪ 2020 Zhou, et al.,ናይ ሙሉእ ቁመት ዘለዎ ሂዩማን ACE2 ኣብ 2.9 Å ሪዞሉሽን ምስ ኣሚኖ ኣሲድ መጎዓዝያ B0AT1 ክራዮ-ኢኤም ህንፀት ከምዘለዎ ገሊፁ።
en-mt: On February 18, 2020 Zhou, et al.,described the cryo-EM construction of full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.

sourceString: They found that the complex, which had open and closed conformations, was assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which provides evidence for CoV recognition and infection.
targetString: እቲ ክፉትን ዕፅዉን ኣሰራርሓ ዘለዎ ኮምፕሌክስ ከም ዳይመር ዝተኣከበ ኮይኑ ናይ ACE2-B0AT1 ኮምፕሌክስ ምስ ክልተ S ፕሮቲናት ክጣመር ከምዝኽእል ተፈሊጡ። እዚ ድማ ንCoV ኣፍልጦን ኢንፌክሽንን መረዳእታ የቕርብ።
en-mt: The complex with open and closed functionality was assembled as a dimer and it was recognized that the ACE2-B0AT1 complex could bind to two S proteins. This provides data for CoV recognition and infection.

sourceString: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.
targetString: ናይ SARS-CoV-2 ኢንፌክሽን ንምዕጋት B0AT1 ተጠቒምካ ናይ መድሓኒት ምፅራይ ምክያድ የድሊ።
en-mt: Inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 infection requires drug screening using B0AT1.

sourceString: The origin and intermediate host
targetString: እቲ መልዓሊን ማእኸላይ ተሸካሚን
en-mt: the hoist and central carrier

sourceString: It has been known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.
targetString: ክልቲኦም SARS-CoVን MERS-CoV ካብ መንካዓት ዝብገሱን ናብ ደቂ-ሰባት ድማ ብ ሲቨት ደማሙን ብ ግመልን ብቕደም ሰዓብ ከምዝተመሓላለፉ ዝፍለጥ እዩ።
en-mt: Both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originate from ticks and are known to be transmitted to humans by civet deer and camels, respectively.

sourceString: Through a phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered the native host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.
targetString: ፋይሎጀነቲክስ ተጠቒምና SARS-CoV-2 ምስ ካልኦት CoVs እንተነፃፅሮ እዚ ሓድሽ ቫይረስ 96% ምስ ካብ ሎኻኺቶ ዝርከቡ bat-SL-CoVZX45ን bat-SL-CoVZX21ን ዝተብሃሉ ክልተ SARS-like CoVs ተመሳሳሊ ብምዃኑ ናይ SARS-CoV-2 ፈላማይ ተሸካማይ ሎኻኺቶ ከምዝኾነ ተገሚቱ ኣሎ።
en-mt: Using phylogenetics, comparing SARS-CoV-2 to other CoVs, this new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from Lochakito, bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21, making it the first Lochakito vector of SARS-CoV-2 .

sourceString: However, what intermediate host helped the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the transmission route is yet to be elucidated.
targetString: ይኹን ደኣምበር፡ ነቲ ቫይረስ ካብ ናይ ዘርኢ ሓጹር ሓሊፉ ኣብ ሰባት ረኽሲ ከስዕብ ዝገበሮ ማእኸላይ መማሓላለፊ እንታይ ከምዝኾነ ኣይተፈለጠን፡ እቲ ዝመሓላለፉሉ መስመር እውን ኣይተፈለየን።
en-mt: However, the central vector that caused the virus to infect humans beyond the seed barrier is unknown, nor is the route of transmission identified.

sourceString: Ji, et al., proposed snakes as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans which involved homologous recombination within the S protein.
targetString: Ji, et al., ተመናት ነቲ ቫይረስ ካብ መንካዓት ናብ ሰባት ኣብምምሕልላፍ ተሸከምቲ ክኾኑ ይኸእሉ ክብል ሓሳብ ኣቕሪቡ እዚ ድማ ምስ S ፕሮቲን ናይ ሆሞሎገስ ናይ ጂናት ምውህሃድ ዘሓወሰ እዩ።
en-mt: Ji, et al., proposed that snakes may be vectors in transmission of the virus from ticks to humans which involves integration of genes homologous to the S protein.

sourceString: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggested that pangolins - long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine - are the potential intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology in a CoV discovered in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: ኣብ ፓንጎሊን ምስ ዝተረኽበ SARS-CoV-2 99% ናይ ጀነቲክ ምምስሳል ብምህላዉ ኣብ ባህላዊ ናይ ቻይና ሕክምና ዝጠቕሙ ከም ፓንጎሊ ዝበሉ ንብዙሕ ጊዜ ዝዘልቁን ፃፀ ዝበልዑን መጥበውቲ እንስሳት ናይ SARS-CoV-2 ማእኸላይ ተሸከምቲ ምዃኖም ኣብ ቻይና ናይ ጉዋንግዦው ተመራመርቲ ከምዝገለፁ ሓደ መፅናዕቲ ይሕብር።
en-mt: Researchers in Guangzhou, China, have found that frequently crawling and ant-eating mammals such as pangolins, which are useful in traditional Chinese medicine, are central carriers of SARS-CoV-2 because of their 99% genetic similarity to SARS-CoV-2 found in pangolins.

sourceString: However, 1% difference spread all over two genomes is still a big difference; thus, conclusive results for concrete evidence are awaited (Fig. ​(Fig.33).
targetString: ኮይኑ ግና ኣብ ክልተ ጄኖማት ናይ 1% ኣፈላላይ ንባዕሉ ዓቢ ኣፈላላይ ብምዃኑ ጭቡጥ መረዳእታ ንምጥቕላል ናይ መወዳእታ ዉፅኢት ምፅባይ የድሊ እዩ።(Fig. ​(Fig.33).
en-mt: However, a difference of 1% in two genomes is a large difference in itself and requires final results to summarize concrete data (Fig. ​ (Fig.33).

sourceString: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely not yet known.
targetString: ናይ SARS-CoV-2 ፊዝዮኬሚካል ፀባይ ክሳብ ሕዚ ኣይተፈልጠን።
en-mt: The physiochemical characteristics of SARS-CoV-2 remain unknown.

sourceString: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.
targetString: SARS-CoVን MERS-CoVን ኣብ ኣስቃጥላ ኣብ ንቑፅ ከባቢ ን48 ሳዓታት ዝኣክል ክነብር ይኽእል ኣብ ትሕቲ 20 ዲግሪ ሰልሺየስን 40%-50% ጠሊን ድማ ንኣስታት 5 ማዓልቲታት ክነብር ይኽእል።
en-mt: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in a dry environment for up to 48 hours in the snow and for about 5 days in temperatures below 20 degrees Celsius and 40%-50% humidity.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar properties.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ተመሳሳሊ ፀባይ ክዉንን ይኽእል እዩ።
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar characteristics.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate the virus.
targetString: ብSARS-CoV-2 ንኣልትራቫዮሌት ጨረራትን ናይ 30 ደቓይቕ በ 56 ዲግሪ ሴንቲ ግሬድ ናይ ሙቐት መጠን ከምዝዳኸም ጸብጻብ ተገይሩ እዩ፡፡ 75% ኢታኖል ፣ ክሎሪን-ዝሓዙ ፀረ-ተሃዋስያን መድሓኒታት ፣ ፒራክቲክ አሲድ ፣ ክሎሮፎርን ካልኦት ናይ ስብሒ ፈሰስትን፣ ግን chlorhexidine ዝኾኑ ፣ ነቲ ቫይረስ ከዳኽሙ ይኽእሉ እዮም፡፡
en-mt: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is attenuated by ultraviolet radiation and a temperature of 56 degrees Celsius for 30 minutes. 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing antiseptics, pyractic acid, chlorophore, and other fatty acids, but not chlorhexidine, can weaken the virus.

sourceString: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and hence is susceptible to the novel virus.
targetString: ደቂ ሰባት ንSARS-CoV-2 ናይ ምክልኻል ዓቕሞም ትሑት ብምዃኑ ንሓደሽቲ ቫይረሳት ተቓላዕቲ ይገብሮም።
en-mt: Humans have low immunity to SARS-CoV-2, making them vulnerable to new viruses.

sourceString: Currently, no detailed study has been reported regarding the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: ኣብዚ ሐዚ እዋን፡ን SARS-CoV-2 ኣብ ዝህሉ ናይ ሰውነት ናይ ምክልኻል መልሲ ኣወሃባ ዝተገበረ ዝርዝር ጽንዓት ኣይተገበረን።
en-mt: Currently, there is no detailed study of the body's immune response to SARS-CoV-2

sourceString: Thus, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. ​(Fig.4).4).
targetString: ብምዃኑ ድማ ነቶም ካልኦት CoVs ብፍላይ ዳማ ናይ SARS-CoVን MERS-CoVን ሕሉፍ መጽናዕቲ ጥራሕ ኢና ክንውከስ ንኽእል(Fig. (Fig.4).4)
en-mt: Therefore, we can only refer to past studies of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV for the other CoVs, especially Dama (Fig. ​ (Fig.4).4).

sourceString: In general, after a virus invades the host, it is first recognized by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
targetString: ብጠቕላላ እቲ ቫይረስ ነቲ ተሸካማይ ድሕሪ ምዉራሩ ፈለማ pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) C-type lectin-like receptors፣ Toll-like receptor (TLR)፣ NOD-like receptor (NLR)፣ and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR) ሓዊስካ በቲ ናይ ተሸካማይ ተፈጥሮኣዊ ሕማም መከላኸሊ ስርዓት ዝልለ እዩ።
en-mt: In total, after the virus invades the carrier it first pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR) by the The carrier's innate immune system is characterized.

sourceString: Through different pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spreading of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.
targetString: ዝተፈላለዩ መንገድታት ብምጥቃም እቲ ቫይረስ ናይ ኢንፍላማቶሪ ፋክተርስ ምፍናው፣ ዴንድራይቲክ ዋህዮታት ምምዕባል ከምኡውን ታይፕ I ኢንተርፌሮንስ (IFNs) ብምፍራይ ናይ እቲ ቫይረስ ምስፍሕፋሕ ንኽቕንስ ይሕግዝ ናይ እቲ ቫይረስ ኣንቲጅን ድማ ብማክሮፌጅ ይወሓጥ።
en-mt: Using a variety of pathways, the virus helps reduce the spread of the virus by releasing inflammatory factors, developing dendritic cells and producing type I interferons (IFNs) and the viral antigen is engulfed by macrophages.

sourceString: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape from the immune responses.
targetString: ናይ SARS-CoV N ፕሮቲን እቲ ቫይረስ ካብ ሕማም መከላኸሊ ስርዓት ንኸምልጥ ዝሕግዞ እዩ።
en-mt: The N protein of SARS-CoV is what helps the virus evade the immune system.

sourceString: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.
targetString: ኣብ እዚ ቀረባ እዋን፣ እቲ ዝተላመደ ናይ ሕማም መከላኸሊ ነቲ ቫይረስ ንምውጋእ ምስቶም ካልኦት ብምዃን ስርሑ ክጅምር እዩ።
en-mt: Soon, the adapted immune system will begin working with the others to fight the virus.

sourceString: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in the defense.
targetString: ከም CD4+ን CD8+ን ዝመሳሰሉ T ሊምፎሳይት ኣብ እቲ ናይ ምክልኻል ስራሕ ዓቢ ታራ ይፃወቱ እዮም።
en-mt: T lymphocytes such as CD4+ and CD8+ play an important role in the immune function.

sourceString: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.
targetString: CD4 + T cell በቲ ቫይረስ ዝተትሓዙ ኣንቲቦዲ ንምምንጫው ናይ B cells የነቃቕሑ። ከምኡውን CD8 + T cell ብቐጥታ በቲ ቫይረስ ዝተትሓዙ ዋህዮታት ይቐትሉ።
en-mt: CD4 + T cell stimulate B cells to produce antibodies infected with the virus. and CD8 + T cell directly kill infected cells.

sourceString: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help the defending cells.
targetString: ቲ ሄልፐር ዋህዮታት(T helper cells) ጸረ ረኽሲ ዝኾነ ሳይቶክይነስ(cytokines) ነቶም ዝከላኸሉ ዋህዮታት ንምሕጋዝ ዘፍሪ እዩ።
en-mt: T helper cells produce anti-infective cytokines to help the protective cells.

sourceString: However, CoV can inhibit T cell functions by inducing apoptosis of T cells.
targetString: ይኹን ደኣምበር፡ CoV ን ናይ ቲ-ዋህዮታት( T cell ) ኣስራርሓታት ኣፖፕቶሲስ(apoptosis) ብምትእትታው ከጥቅዑ ይኽእሉ እዮም።
en-mt: However, CoV can attack T cell mechanisms by inducing apoptosis.

sourceString: The humoral immunity including complements such as C3a and C5a and antibodies is also essential in combating the viral infection.
targetString: እቲ ቫይረስ ንምዕጋት ከም C3a፣ C5aን ኣንቲቦዲታትን ዝመሳሰሉ ሂዩመራል መከላኸሊ ሕማም ኣድለይቲ እዮም።
en-mt: Humoral immunoglobulins such as C3a, C5a and antibodies are necessary to inhibit the virus.

sourceString: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient neutralized MERS-CoV.
targetString: ንኣብነት ካብ ዝደሓኑ ሕሙማት ዝተወስዱ ኣንቲቦዲታት ንMERS-CoV ኣዳኺሞሞ እዮም።
en-mt: For example, antibodies from surviving patients have attenuated MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates a large number of free radicals locally that can cause severe damages to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst scenario, multi-organ failure and even death.
targetString: ብ ኻሊእ ወገን፡ ካብ እቲ ስርዓት መከላኸሊ ሰብነትና ዝገብሮ ካብ ዓቐን ንላዕሊ ዝኾነ ግብረ መልሲ ዝተልዓለ ብዙሕ መጠን ዘለዎ ናጻ ራዲካላት ኣብ ሳንቡእ ኣብ ካልኦት ኣካላት ሰብነትን ከቢድ ጉድኣት ከስዕቡ ዘኸእሉ ብምዃኖም ኣብ እቲ ዝገደደ ኩነታት ድማ ካብ ሓደ ንላዕሊ ዝኾኑ ኣካላት ጉድኣት ብምስዓብ ናብ ሞት እውን ከብቅዑ ዝኽእሉ እዮም።
en-mt: On the other hand, large amounts of free radicals caused by an overreaction by the immune system can cause serious damage to the lungs and other organs, in the worst cases causing damage to more than one organ and even death are.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 infection, featured by clustering onset, is more likely to affect elderly people with comorbidities and pregnant women.
targetString: ናይ SARS-CoV-2 ረኽሲ ፡ ብ ጉጅለ ዝጀመረ ምስ ምዃኑ፡ ኣብ ሕዱር ናይ ጥዕና ጸገም ዘለዎም ኣረጋውያንን ጥኑሳትን ብዝበለጸ ጽልዋ ከሕድር ይኽእል።
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infection , with its group onset, may best affect the elderly and pregnant women with chronic health problems.

sourceString: It is common that for people who are exposed to a large number of viruses or whose immune functions are compromised, they have higher chance to be infected than others.
targetString: ኣብ እቶም ናብ ብዙሓት ቫይረሳት ዝተጋለጹን ናይ ሰብነቶም ሕማም ናይ ምክልኻል ዓቕሞም ዝተዳኸሙን ሰባት ካብ ካልኦት ዝለዓለ ብ ረኽሲ ናይ ምጥቃዕ ተኸእሎኦም ልሙድ እዩ።
en-mt: People who are exposed to many viruses and have weakened immune systems are more likely to get infected than others.

sourceString: The estimated mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.
targetString: ናይ SARS-CoV-2 ናይ መጫጭሒ እዋን ብማእኸላይ 1-14 ማዓልትታት እንትኸዉን ኣብቶም ኣብ ዉሃን ዝተረኽቡ ናይ መጀምርታ 425 ጉዳያት ለበዳ ከምዝተፀንዐ ድማ ብኣብዝሓ 3-7 ማዕልትታት እዩ ዝፀንሕ።
en-mt: The incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 averages 1-14 days and lasts a maximum of 3-7 days as studied in the first 425 cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: However, a study on 1,099 cases demonstrates that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.
targetString: ኮይኑ ግና ኣብ 1,099 ጉዳያት ለበዳ ዝተገብረ መፅናዕቲ ናይ ኢንኩቤሽን እዋን ብማእኸላይ 3 ማዓልቲ እንትኸዉን ካብ 0 ክሳብ 24 ማዓልትታት ድማ ክፀንሕ ከም ዝኽእል ሓቢሩ።
en-mt: However, a study of 1,099 outbreak cases found that the incubation period averaged 3 days and could range from 0 to 24 days.

sourceString: A more recent study, as described above, demonstrates that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demography of 8,866 cases.
targetString: ኣብ ላዕሊ ከምዝተገለፀ ኣብ ቀረባ እዋን ኣብ 8,866 ህዝቢ ዝተገብረ መፅናዕቲ ናይ መጫጭሒ እዋን 4.8 (3.0-7.2) ማዕልትታት ምዃኑ ገሊፁ።
en-mt: As mentioned above, a recent study of 8,866 populations found that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.

sourceString: It is very important for health authorities to adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period, thus preventing infected but symptomless people from transmitting the virus to others.
targetString: ን ናይ ሕክምና ሰበ ስልጣን ነቲ ናይ ምውሻብ እዋን ምስ እቲ ኣዝዩ ትኽክለኛ ዝኾነ ናይ መጫጭሒ እዋን ክስተኻኸል ብምግባር ምልክት ዘየርእዩ ሕሙማት ነቲ ሕማም ናብ ካልኦት ከየመሓላልፉ ክግብሩ ኣለዎም።
en-mt: Medical authorities should adjust the quarantine period to the most accurate quarantine period to prevent asymptomatic patients from transmitting the disease.

sourceString: As a common practice, individuals exposed to, or infected by, the virus are usually required to be quarantined for 14 days.
targetString: ከም ልሙድ በቲ ቫይረስ ዝተጠቕዑ ሰባት ን14 ማዓልትታት ክዉሸቡ ይግበር።
en-mt: Typically, infected people are quarantined for 14 days.

sourceString: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?
targetString: እቲ ናይ ውሸባ ጊዜ ናብ 24 መዓልቲታት ክናዋሕ ኣለዎ ዶ?
en-mt: Should the quarantine period be extended to 24 days?

sourceString: Fever is often the major and initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be accompanied by no symptom or other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle ache, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
targetString: ናይ COVID-19 ፈላማይን ኣገዳሲን ምልክት ረስኒ ኮይኑ በይኑ ወይድማ ከም ደረቕ ሳዓል፣ ትንፋስ ምሕፃር፣ ናይ ጭዋዳ ቃንዛ፣ ርእሲ ምዝዋር፣ ሕማም ርእሲ፣ ናይ ጎሮር ቃንዛ፣ ራይኖርያ፣ ናይ ደረት ቃንዛ፣ ተቕማጥ፣ ዕዉልዉል ምባልን ተምላስን ዝመሳሰሉ ካልኦት ምልክታት ሒዙ ክመፅእ ይኽእል እዩ።
en-mt: The first and most important symptom of COVID-19 is fever and can come alone or with other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle aches, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea and vomiting .

sourceString: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.
targetString: ገለ ሕሙማት በቲ ሕማም ምስተትሓዙ ድሕሪ ሓደ ስሙን ናይ dyspnea ን / ወይ hypoxemia ምልክታት ኣርእዮም እዮም።
en-mt: Some patients have had symptoms of dyspnea and / or hypoxemia one week after infection.

sourceString: In severe cases, patients quickly progressed to develop acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.
targetString: ኣብ ከበድቲ ኩነታት፡ ሕሙማት ክቢድ ናይ መተንፈሲ ጸገም ፡ ሴፕቲክ ሾክ( septic shock)፡ ሜታቦሊክ ኣሲዶሲስ(metabolic acidosis)ን ኮኣጉሎፓቲ(coagulopathy) ብቕልጡፍ የማዕብሉ እዮም።
en-mt: In severe cases, patients develop severe respiratory distress , septic shock, metabolic acidosis and coagulopathy rapidly.

sourceString: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without pulmonary imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.
targetString: ረስኒ ወይድማ ናይ ምስትንፋስ ምልክታትን ሃንደበታዊ ረስኒን ዘለዎም ሕሙማት ነቲ ሕማም ዝገልፅ ናይ ሳምባ ራጂ ዉፅኢት ዋላ ተዘይሃለወ ቅልጡፍ ዲያግኖሲስ ንምርካብ ነቲ ቫይረስ ክምርመሩ ይግባእ እዩ።
en-mt: Patients with fever or respiratory symptoms and sudden cough should be tested for the virus for early diagnosis even if there is no lung x-ray result.

sourceString: A demographic study in late December of 2019 showed that the percentages of the symptoms were 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of the patients required ventilation support.
targetString: ኣብ መወዳእታ ወርሒ ዲሴምበር 2019 ዝተገበረ ሓደ ናይ ስነ ሕዝቢ ምርምር ከምዘርእዮ ናይ እቲ ሕማም ምልክታት ንጽጽራዊ መጠን ናይ ረስኒ 98% ፣ ናይ ደረቅ ስዓል 76% ፣ ናይ ድርቀት 55% ፣ ከምኡውን ናይ ተቅማጥ 3% ፣ ካብ ጠቕላላ ሕሙማት 8% ዝኾኑ ድማ ናይ መተንፈሲ ድጋፍ ዝደልዩ እዮም።
en-mt: A demographic survey conducted in late December 2019 showed that the comparative rates of symptoms were fever 98%, dry cough 76%, dehydration 55%, and diarrhea 3%, and ventilatory support for 8% of the total patients They are seeking.

sourceString: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cluster and a cluster caused by transmission from an asymptomatic individual.
targetString: ኣብ ክልተ ናይ ቀረባ እዋን መፅናዕትታት ናይ ስድራ እኩብን ካሊእ ካብ ሓደ ምልክት ዘይብሉ ሰብ ዝተላገቡ ናይ ሰባት እኩብን ተመሳሳሊ ዉፅኢት ተረኺቡ።
en-mt: Similar results were found in two recent studies of a family cohort and another cohort of people infected from an asymptomatic person.

sourceString: Comparably, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.
targetString: ብተነፃፃሪ፣ ኣብ 2012 ዝተገብረ ናይ ስነ-ህዝቢ መፅናዕቲ ናይ MERS-CoV ሕሙማት ዋና ምልክታት ረስኒ (98%)፣ ደረቕ ሰዓልን (47%) ሕፅረት ምትንፋስን (55%) ምዃኖም ገሊፁ።
en-mt: In comparison, a 2012 demographic study of MERS-CoV patients stated that the main symptoms were fever (98%), dry cough (47%) and shortness of breath (55%).

sourceString: However, 80% of them required ventilation support, much more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than of COVID-19.
targetString: ኮይኑ ግና ካብ COVID-19 ንላዕሊ 80% ዝኾኑ ናይ ምስትንፋስ ሓገዝ ዘድልዮም እዮም። ብጣዕሚ ሓደገኛ ብምዃኑ ድማ ካብ ምስ COVID-19 ምስ MERS ይመሳሰል።
en-mt: However, more than 80% of COVID-19 patients require ventilatory assistance. It is so dangerous that it is more similar to MERS than to COVID-1

sourceString: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed with MERS patients.
targetString: ተቕማጥ (26%) ፡ ዝቖሰለ ጉሮሮ( 21%) ኣብ ናይ MERS ሕሙማት እውን ተራእዮም እዮም።
en-mt: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also reported in MERS patients.

sourceString: In SARS patients, it has been demonstrated that fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and ventilation support was required for approximately 14%-20% of the patients.
targetString: ረስኒ (99%-100%)፣ ደረቕ ሰዓል (29%-75%)፣ ሕፅረት ምስትንፋስ (40%-42%)፣ ተቕማጥን (20-25%) ናይ ጎሮሮ ቃንዛን (13-25%) ናይ SARS ሕሙማት ዋናዋና ምልክታት ኮይኖም ናይ ምስትንፋስ ሓገዝ ድማ ንኣስታት 14%-20% ዝኾኑ ሕሙማት ኣድላዪ ኮይኑ ተረኺቡ ኣሎ።
en-mt: Fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), shortness of breath (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%) and sore throat (13-25%) are the main symptoms of SARS patients Ventilatory assistance is necessary for about 14%-20% of patients.

sourceString: By February 14, the mortality of COVID-19 was 2% when the confirmed cases reached 66,576 globally.
targetString: ክሳብ ፌብሩዋሪ 14፡ ብ ብርኪ ዓለም እቲ ኣጠቓላሊ ጉዳያት ለበዳ 66:576 እንክበጽሕ እንከሎ፡ ናይ COVID-19 ሞት ሓደጋ 2% ነይሩ።
en-mt: As of February 14, the total cases globally reached 66:576, with a COVID-19 death risk of 2%.

sourceString: Comparably, the mortality of SARS by November 2002 was 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.
targetString: ብተነጻጻሪ፣ ኣብ ኖቨምበር 2002 ናይ SARS ናይ ሞት መጠን ካብ 8,096 ዝተረጋገጹ ጉዳያት 10% ኾይኑ ተረኺቡ ኣሎ።
en-mt: In comparison, in November 2002 the SARS mortality rate was found to be 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.

sourceString: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, the mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.
targetString: MERS ብዝምልከት፡ ኣብ ጁን 2012 ዝተገበረ ናይ ሰነ-ህዝቢ(demographic ) ጽንዓት መሰረት፡ ብ 2,494 ዝኾኑ ዝተረጋገጹ ጉዳያት ናይ ሞት መጠን 37% እዩ ነይሩ።
en-mt: With regard to MERS, based on a June 2012 demographic survey, the mortality rate was 37% with 2,494 confirmed cases.

sourceString: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, whereas the R0 of SARS-CoV only ranged from 2 to 4.
targetString: ናይ SARS-CoV-2 R0 ክሳብ 6.47 ምስ 5.71-7.23 95% confidence interval (CI) እንትበፅሕ ናይ SARS-CoV R0 ግና ካብ 2 ክሳብ 4 ጥራሕ ምዃኑ ቅድም ክብል ዝወፀ መፅናዕቲ ይሕብር።
en-mt: The R0 of SARS-CoV-2 reached up to 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, whereas the R0 of SARS-CoV was only 2 to 4, according to a previously published study.

sourceString: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV regarding their symptoms, mortality, and R0 is presented in Table ​Table1.1.
targetString: ብመንጽር ዘርእዩዎ ምልክታት፡ሞትን R0 ኣብ መንጎ SARS-CoV-2 ምስ MERS-CoV ን SARA-CoV ዝተገበረ ንጽጽር ኣብ Table1.1 ቀሪቡ ኣሎ።
en-mt: A comparison between SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV in terms of symptoms,mortality and R0 is presented in Table1.1.

sourceString: The above figures suggest that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it is less lethal than the latter two.
targetString: ምስ MERS-CoVን SARS-CoVን ተነፃፂሩ SARS-CoV-2 ዝለዓለ ናይ ምልባዕ ክእለት እንትህልዎ ዝተሓተ ድማ ቀታልነት ከምዘለዎ እቲ ኣብ ላዕሊ ዝተገልፀ ኣሃዝ ይሕብር።
en-mt: Compared to MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 has the highest infectious ability and the lowest lethality, according to the above figure.

sourceString: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
targetString: ስለዝኾነ ካብ MERS-CoVን SARS-CoVን ንላዕሊ ናይ SARS-CoV-2 ለበዳ ምቁፅፃር ከቢድ እዩ።
en-mt: Therefore, the outbreak of SARS-CoV-2 is more difficult to control than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Clustered onset often happens in the same family or from the same gathering or vehicle such as a cruise ship.
targetString: ናይ ጉጅለ ተበግሶታት ለበዳ ኣብ ተመሳሳሊ ስድራ ቤት ወይድማ ካብ ተመሳሳሊ ምትእኽኻባት ወይድማ ኣብ ከም ናይ መጓዓዚያ መርከብ ዝበሉ ተሽከርከርከርቲ እዩ ዘጋጥም።
en-mt: Group initiatives outbreaks occur in the same family or from the same gatherings or in vehicles such as a transport ship.

sourceString: Patients often have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected individuals or patients in the recent two weeks before the onset.
targetString: ሕሙማት ብኣብዝሓ ናይ ጉዕዞ ታሪኽ ዘለዎም፣ ኣብ ዉሃን ወይድማ ኣብ ካልኦት ዝተጠቕዑ ቦታታት ዝነብሩ፣ ምስ ዝተጠቕዐ ወይከዓ ምስ ሕማም ዘይጀመሮም ሰባት ኣብ ዝሓለፉ ክልተ ሰሙናት ርክብ ዝነበሮም እዮም።
en-mt: Patients mostly have travel history, live in Wuhan or other affected areas, and have had contact with infected or non-onset people in the past two weeks.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms longer than two weeks and cured patients discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, which sends out an alarm to increase the time for quarantine.
targetString: ይኹን ደኣምበር ሕሙማት ምልክት ከየርኣዩ ንነዊሕ እዋን ክጸንሑ ስለዝኽእሉን ዝሓወዩ ሕሙማት ድማ ን ካልእይ ግዘ እቲ ቫይረስ ክስከሙ ስለዝኽእሉን ናይ ውሸባ እዋን ክነውሕ ከምዝግባእ የረድኡ።
en-mt: However, the quarantine period should be extended as patients can remain asymptomatic for a long time and recovered patients can carry the virus a second time.

sourceString: Patients have normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) at the early stage.
targetString: ኣብ እቲ ናይ መጀመሪያ ደርጃ፡ ሕሙማት ዝተሓተ ወይድማ ልሙድ ናይ ፐሪፈራል ጻዓዱ ናይ ደም ዋህዮታት(ብተለይ ልይሞፎሳይት) ኣለዎም።
en-mt: In the early stage, patients have low or normal peripheral white blood cells(especially lymophocytes).

sourceString: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.
targetString: ን ኣብነት፣ ልይምፎፐኒያ ምስ ጻዕዳ ናይ ደም ዋህዮ ቁጽሪ < 4×109/L ን ልይሞፎሳይት ቁጽሪ ሓዊሱ < 1×109/L፣ ምስኡ ድማ መጠኑ ልዕል ዝበለ ናይ ኣስፓራቴት ኣሚኖትራንስፈሬዝ ደረጃታትን ቬሪሚያን ኣብ 1,099 ናይ COVID-19 ሕሙማት ተረኺቦም እዮም።
en-mt: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L and lymophocytic count including < 1×109/L, accompanied by moderately elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia have been reported in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: The levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin were increased in the blood of some patients, and C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation were increased in the blood of most patients.
targetString: መብዛሕቲኦም ሕሙማት ኣብ ደሞም ናይ C-ሪኣክቲቭ ፕሮቲንን ኢራይትሮሳይት ሰድመንቴሽንን መጠን ክብ ከምዝበለን ኣብ ዝተወሰኑ ሕሙማት ድማ ናይ ፀሊም ከብዲን ናይ ጭዋዳ ኤንዛይማት ከምኡውን ናይ ማዮግሎቢን መጠን ኣብ ደሞም ሓፍ ከምዝበለ ይግለፅ።
en-mt: Most patients had elevated blood levels of C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation, and in some patients elevated blood levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin.

sourceString: In patients with severe cases, the level of D-dimer, a fibrin degradation product present in the blood, was elevated, and lymphocyte count was progressively reduced.
targetString: ከቢድ ጉዳያት ኣብ ዘለዎም ሕሙማት፡ ናይ D-dimer መጠን፡ ኣብ ደም ዝርከብ ናይ ፊብሪን(fibrin) ፍርያት፡ ወሲኹ እዩ፡ ናይ ልይሞፎሳይት(lymphocyte) ቁጽሪ ድማ ኣዝዩ ቀኒሱ እዩ።
en-mt: In patients with severe cases, levels of D-dimer, a product of fibrin in the blood, have increased, and lymphocyte counts have decreased significantly.

sourceString: Abnormalities in chest radiography are found in most COVID-19 patients and featured by bilateral patchy shadows or ground glass opacity in the lungs.
targetString: ኣብ ናይ ደረት ራድዮግራፊ ዝረኣዩ ዘይልሙዳት ምልክታት ኣብ መብዛሕቲኡ ናይ COVID-19 ሕሙማት ይርከቡ እዮም፣ ኣብ ሳንባ ብዝረኣዩ ኽልተ መዳይ ዝረኣዩ ዝተጣበቑ ጽላሎታት(patchy shadows) ወይድማ ናይ መሬት ብርጭቆ ብርሃን ምኽልካል(ground glass opacity) ዝኣምሰሉ ምልክታት ዝግለጽ እዩ።
en-mt: Unusual signs on chest radiography are found in most COVID-19 patients, characterized by patchy shadows or ground glass opacity in the lungs.

sourceString: Patients often develop an atypical pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: ብኣብዝሓ ሕሙማት ናብ ዘይንቡር ኒሞኒያ፣ ሃንደበታዊ ጉድኣት ሳምባን ኣክዩት ሪስፓራይቶሪ ዲስትረስ ሲንድሮምን (ARDS) ይቃልዑ።
en-mt: Increasingly, patients develop pneumonia, sudden lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).

sourceString: When ARDS happens, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely compromise the gas exchange.
targetString: ARDS ካብ ቁፅፅር ወፃእ ዝኾነ ነድሪ፣ ናይ ፈሳሲ ምእካብ ከምኡውን ቀፃሊ ዝኾነ ፋይብሮሲስ ብምፍጣር ናይ ኣየር ምቅይያር ፀገም ዘምፅእ እዩ።
en-mt: ARDS causes uncontrolled inflammation, fluid retention and persistent fibrosis resulting in aerobic disorders.

sourceString: Dysfunction of type-I and type-II pneumocytes decreases the surfactant level and increases surface tension, thus reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and heightening the risk of lung collapse.
targetString: type-Iን type-IIን ኒሞሳይት ብኣግባቡ ምስራሕ እንተዘይክኢሎም መጠን ሰርፋክታንት ስለዝቕንስ ናይ ሳምባ ደጋዊ ወጥሪ ንኽውስኽ ብምግባር እቲ ሳምባ ናይ ምስፋሕ ዓቕሙ ቀኒሱ ንኽዕፆ ይገብር።
en-mt: If type-I and type-II pneumocytes fail to function appropriately, the amount of surfactant decreases, causing an increase in lung outer tension, reducing the ability of the lung to expand and causing it to close.

sourceString: Therefore, the worst chest radiographic findings often parallel the most severe extent of the disease.
targetString: ስለዚ እቲ ዝኸፍአ ናይ ሳንቡእ ራጂ ዉፅኢት እንትንረክብ ብኣብዝሓ ምስ ዝኸፍአ ናይ ሕማም ደረጃ ዝተተኣሳሰረ እዩ።
en-mt: Therefore, the worst lung x-ray results are mostly associated with worse disease stage.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, the first pathological analysis of COVID-19 demonstrated the desquamation of pneumocytes, hyaline membrane formation, and interstitial lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of a patient who died of the disease, consistent with the pathology of viral infection and ARDS and similar to that of SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: ኣብ ፌብሩዋሪ 18, 2020 እቲ ናይ መጀመርታ ናይ COVID-19 ናይ ሕማም ምርመራ ምስ ናይ ካልኦት ናይ ቫይረስ ሕማማትን ARDSን ምስ ናይ SARSን MERSን ምልክታት ብተመሳሳሊ፤ ናይ ሳምባ ምቺ ህውከት፣ ናይ hyaline membraneን ካብ እቲ ሕማም ኣብ ዝሞተ ሰብ ድማ ናይ multinucleated syncytial cellsን ኣብ ሳምባ ውሽጢ ምፍጣርን ዝኣመሰሉ ምልክታት ተራእዮም እዮም።
en-mt: On February 18, 2020, the first COVID-19 diagnosis was made with symptoms of other viral diseases and ARDS similar to those of SARS and MERS; Pulmonary chaos, hyaline membrane and in a person who died from the disease multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs have been observed.

sourceString: The detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA via reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) was used as the major criteria for the diagnosis of COVID-19.
targetString: ብ ሪቨርስ-ትራንስክሪፕቴዝ-ፖሊሜሬዝ(reverse-transcriptase polymerase) ን ሳርስ(SARS-CoV-2 RNA) ምፍላይ ኣብ ናይ COVID-19 ዝግበር ምርመራ ከም ዋና ሮቕሓ ኣብ ጥቕሚ ውዒሉ ነይሩ።
en-mt: Detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA by reverse-transcriptase polymerase was used as the main criterion in the diagnosis of COVID-1

sourceString: However, due to the high false-negative rate, which may accelerate the epidemic, clinical manifestations started to be used for diagnosis (which no longer solely relied on RT-PCR) in China on February 13, 2020.
targetString: ኮይኑ ግና ናይ ሓሶት-ኣሉታዊ መጠን ሓፍ ዝበለ ብምዃኑ እቲ ለበዳ ከጋድዶ ስለዝኽእል ኣብ ቻይና ካብ 13 ፌብሩዋሪ፣ 2020 ንዳሓር ክሊኒካዊ ምልክታት ብምጥቃም ዲያግኖስ ምግባር ተጀሚሩ (ኣብ RT-PCR ጥራሕ ኣይድረኽን) ኣሎ።
en-mt: However, the high false-negative rate could exacerbate the outbreak and diagnosis using clinical signs has been introduced in China since February 13, 2020 (not driven by RT-PCR alone).

sourceString: A similar situation also occurred with the diagnosis of SARS.
targetString: ኣብ ናይ SARS ምርመራ እውን ተመሳሳሊ ኩነታት ኣጋጢሙ ነይሩ።
en-mt: The same situation occurred in the SARS investigation.

sourceString: Therefore, a combination of disease history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests, and radiological findings is essential and imperative for making an effective diagnosis.
targetString: ስለዚ ናይ እቲ ሕማም ታሪኽ፣ ክሊኒካዊ ምልክታት፣ ላብራቶሪ ምርመራታትን ናይ ራጂ ዉፅኢትን ብጠቕላላ ኣብ ዉፅኢታዊ ዝኾነ ዲያግኖሲስ ንምብፃሕ ኣገደስቲ እዮም።
en-mt: Therefore, the history of the disease, clinical signs, laboratory tests, and x-ray findings are altogether important to reach an effective diagnosis.

sourceString: On February 14, 2020, the Feng Zhang group described a protocol of using the CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique to detect SARS-CoV-2, which detects synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fragments at 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter of input) using a dipstick in less than an hour without requiring elaborate instrumentation.
targetString: ኣብ ፌብሩዋሪ 14:2020፡ ናይ ፌንግ ጃንግ ጉጅለ SARS-CoV-2 ንምፍላይ ዝጠቅም ኣብ CRISPR-ዝተመስረተ ናይ SHERLOCK ቴክኒክ ዝምልከት ናይ ኣጠቓቕማ ፕሮቶኮል ዕላዊ ገይሮም እዮም፡ እዚ ድማ፡ ሲንተቲክ ናይ SARS-CoV-2 RNA ክፋላት ንምፍላይ ዘኽእል ብ 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 ቅዳሓት ብ ማይክሮሊትር ኣታዊ) ብዝኾነ መጠን ዲፕሲቲክ(dipstick) ብምጥቃም ትሕቲ ሓደ ሰዓት ተወሳኺ መሳርሒ ምጥቃም ከይኣድለየ ንምፍላይ ዘኽእል እዩ።
en-mt: On February 14:2020, Feng Zhang's group announced a use protocol for the CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique for the detection of SARS-CoV-2, which allows for the detection of synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fractions at 20 × -18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter input) using a dipstick in less than an hour without the need for additional equipment.

sourceString: Hopefully, the new technique can dramatically enhance the sensitivity and convenience if verified in clinical samples.
targetString: እቲ ሓዱሽ ቴክኒክ ተዓጻጻፊ ብዝኾነ መልክዑ ናይ ተኣፋፍነትን ምቹውነትን ለውጢ ዘምጽእ ከምዝኾን ተስፋ ኣሎ።
en-mt: The new technique is expected to bring about a change in urgency and convenience in a flexible manner.

sourceString: Due to the lack of experience with the novel CoV, physicians can mainly provide supportive care to COVID-19 patients, while attempting a variety of therapies that have been used or proposed before for the treatment of other CoVs such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV and other viral diseases (Table ​(Table2).2).
targetString: ኣብ ኖቭል CoV ናይ ተሞክሮ ሕፅረት ብምህላዉ፣ ሓኻይም ንCOVID-19 ሕሙማት ሓፈሻዊ ሓገዝ ጥራሕ ክህቡ ከምዝኽእሉ ይፍለጥ። ብጎናጎኒ ድማ ከም SARS-CoVን MERS-CoVን ዝመሳሰሉ ዓይነታት CoVs ከምኡዉን ንካልኦት ናይ ቫይረስ ሕማማት ንጥቀመሎም ፈውሲታት ተጠቒምካ ፈተነ ይካየድ ኣሎ።(Table ​(Table2).2).
en-mt: Due to a lack of experience in novel CoV, doctors can only provide general care to COVID-19 patients. In parallel, trials are being conducted with CoVs such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV as well as treatments for other viral diseases (Table ​ (Table2).2).

sourceString: These therapies include current and potential treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.
targetString: እዞም ሕክምናታት ኣንቲ ቫይራል መድሓኒት፣ ኢሚኖሳፕረሰንት፣ ስቴሮይድ፣ ካብ ዝደሓኑ ሕሙማት ዝተወስደ ፕላዝማ፣ ናይ ቻይና ሕክምና ከምኡውን ስነልቦናዊ ሓገዝ ዘካተቱ እዮም።
en-mt: These treatments include antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from survivors, Chinese medicine and psychological support.

sourceString: Even plasma from recovered patients was proposed to be used for treatment.
targetString: ካብ ዝደሓኑ ሕሙማት ዝተወስደ ፕላዝማ እዉን ከም ፈውሲ ክንጥቀመሉ ከምእንኽእል ሓሳብ ቀሪቡ ኣሎ።
en-mt: It has also been suggested that plasma from survivors can be used as a cure.

sourceString: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.
targetString: ናይ መድሓኒት ኩባንያታት ኣንቲ ቦዲን ናይ እቲ ቫይረስ ክትባትን ን ምምዕባል ይጽዕሩ ኣለዉ።
en-mt: Pharmaceutical companies are trying to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 mainly attacks the lungs in the beginning and probably also attacks, to a lesser degree, other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and the kidneys.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ብዋናነት ሳምባ ዘጥቅዕ ኮይኑ ብዝተወሰነ መጠን ድማ ከም ናይ ማዓንጣ ትራክት ስርዓትን ኩላሊትን ዝመሳሰሉ ካልኦት ACE2 ዘለዎም ኣካላት የጥቅዕ።
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 primarily affects the lungs and to a lesser extent other ACE2-containing organs such as the gastrointestinal tract system and the kidneys.

sourceString: Nevertheless, respiratory dysfunction and failure are the major threat to the patients and the major cause of death.
targetString: ይኹን ደኣምበር፡ ናይ መተንፈሲ ጸገማትን ውድቀትን ን ሕሙማት እቶም ዓበይቲ ሓደጋታትን ሞት ዘስዕቡ ዋና መበገሲታት እዮም።
en-mt: However, respiratory problems and failure are the main causes of death for patients.

sourceString: Thus, respiratory support is critical to relieve the symptoms and save lives and includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation depending on the severity of the disease.
targetString: ስለዚ ድማ፡ ናይ መተንፈሲ ሓገዝ ነቶም ምልክታት ኣብ ምቕናስ ን ህይወት ኣብ ምድሓንን ኣዝዩ ወሳኒ እንትኾን፡ ኣጠቓላሊ ኦክስጅን፡ ከም ፍልልያት ክብደት እቲ ሕማም ድማ ልዑል-ፍሰት ኦክስጅን(high-flow oxygen)፡ ነንኢንቫሲቭ ቨንቲሌሽን(noninvasive ventilation) ን ኢንቫሲቭ መካኒካዊ ቬንቲሌሽን ( invasive mechanical ventilation) ዘጠቓለለ እዩ።
en-mt: Therefore, ventilatory assistance is critical in reducing the symptoms and saving lives, while total oxygen, and high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation and invasive mechanical ventilation ( invasive) depending on the severity of the disease mechanical ventilation) included.

sourceString: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms have to be supported by extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used for the treatment of life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.
targetString: ከቢድ ናይ ምትንፋስ ፀገም ምልክታት ዘለዎም ሕሙማት ብ ኤክስትራኮርፖሪያል መምብሬን ኦክስጅን (ECMO)፣ ከቢድ ናይ ልቢ ወይድማ ናይ ምስትንፋስ ፀገም ንዘለዎም ሕሙማት ንጥቀመሉ ዝተሓደሰ ካርዲዮፐልመናሪ ባይፓስ ቴክኒክ ዝሕገዙ እዮም።
en-mt: Patients with severe respiratory failure are treated with extracorporeal membrane oxygen (ECMO), a regenerated cardiopulmonary bypass technique for use in patients with severe cardiac or respiratory failure.

sourceString: In addition, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, the prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and the protection of the functions of the vital organs are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.
